engagement_strategies.title: Think-Pair-Share Technique
engagement_strategies.description: Students think individually, discuss with a partner, then share with the class. Increases participation by 65%.
engagement_strategies.implementation: Pose a question, give 2 min individual thinking, 3 min pair discussion, 5 min class sharing

engagement_strategies.title: Socratic Questioning Method
engagement_strategies.description: Ask open-ended questions that stimulate critical thinking. Increases curiosity index by 70%.
engagement_strategies.implementation: Use 'Why', 'How', 'What if' questions. Wait 5-7 seconds for responses.

engagement_strategies.title: Optimal Teaching Speed
engagement_strategies.description: Maintain 130-160 WPM for complex topics, 160-180 WPM for review sessions.
engagement_strategies.implementation: Use pauses every 10-12 minutes. Check for understanding signals.

engagement_strategies.title: Cold Calling with Support
engagement_strategies.description: Randomly call on students but provide thinking time first. Increases attention by 60%.
engagement_strategies.implementation: Announce question, wait 10 seconds, then call on student. Provide scaffolding if needed.

engagement_strategies.title: Real-Time Formative Assessment
engagement_strategies.description: Use quick checks every 15 minutes to gauge understanding. Improves retention by 65%.
engagement_strategies.implementation: Use thumbs up/down, mini-quizzes, or digital polls

attention_strategies.title: Attention Reset Technique
attention_strategies.description: Brief 2-minute activities to reset attention spans. Research shows 85% attention recovery.
attention_strategies.implementation: Quick stretch, brain teaser, or relevant story

attention_strategies.title: Multi-Modal Presentation
attention_strategies.description: Combine visual, auditory, and kinesthetic elements. Increases attention by 70%.
attention_strategies.implementation: Use diagrams, videos, demonstrations, and hands-on activities

attention_strategies.title: Strategic Movement Breaks
attention_strategies.description: Incorporate movement every 25 minutes. Boosts attention by 55%.
attention_strategies.implementation: Stand and stretch, move to different groups, or physical demonstrations

interaction_strategies.title: Equity Sticks Method
interaction_strategies.description: Ensure all students participate equally. Increases hand raises by 80%.
interaction_strategies.implementation: Use name sticks/cards, track participation, ensure everyone contributes

interaction_strategies.title: Structured Academic Controversy
interaction_strategies.description: Students debate different perspectives. Increases curiosity by 75%.
interaction_strategies.implementation: Assign positions, research, debate, then switch sides

interaction_strategies.title: Jigsaw Learning
interaction_strategies.description: Students become experts on subtopics and teach peers. Boosts retention by 80%.
interaction_strategies.implementation: Divide topic into parts, expert groups study, then teach home groups

sentiment_strategies.title: Growth Mindset Language
sentiment_strategies.description: Use language that promotes learning from mistakes. Improves sentiment by 65%.
sentiment_strategies.implementation: Say 'not yet' instead of 'no', celebrate effort and progress

sentiment_strategies.title: Personal Connection Time
sentiment_strategies.description: Spend 2 minutes at start connecting personally. Increases engagement by 55%.
sentiment_strategies.implementation: Greet students, share relevant personal story, show genuine interest

retention_strategies.title: Spaced Repetition
retention_strategies.description: Review material at increasing intervals. Improves retention by 90%.
retention_strategies.implementation: Quick review at start, mid-class recap, end summary, next-day warm-up

retention_strategies.title: Connect to Prior Knowledge
retention_strategies.description: Link new concepts to existing knowledge. Increases retention by 75%.
retention_strategies.implementation: Start with 'What do you already know about...', use analogies, real-world examples

retention_strategies.title: Low-Stakes Testing
retention_strategies.description: Frequent quizzes without grades. Boosts retention by 85%.
retention_strategies.implementation: 3-5 question quiz at start or end, immediate feedback, no grade impact
